Detailed Description

Substance engine handle structure and related functions definitions.

Author:
Christophe Soum - Allegorithmic (christophe.soum@allegorithmic.com)
Note:
This file is part of the Substance engine headers
Date:
20080107
Copyright (c) Allegorithmic. All rights reserved.
Version:
2137
  • substanceHandlePushOutputs function modified: output selection from texture sets removed.
  • substanceHandleGetOutputs function modified: SubstanceGrabMethod enumeration removed (only Grab method is available).
    Replaced by output interpretation flag.
Defines the SubstanceHandle structure. Initialized from a SubstanceContext and a buffer that contains the Substance cooked data to render. This handle is used to set up generation parameters, select textures to render, fill-in inputs, launch the generation process and grab resulting textures.
The rendering process can be launched synchronously or asynchronously (in one go or using time-slicing). The process workload can be dispatched on the different hardware units.
Generated textures can be grabbed progressively using a callback function or at a stretch at the end of generation.

Summary of functions defined in this file:

Handle creation and deletion:

  • substanceHandleInit
  • substanceHandleRelease

Render list management:

  • substanceHandlePushOutputs
  • substanceHandlePushSetInput (advanced usage)
  • substanceHandleFlush (advanced usage)

Generation process start/stop, resources switch, and state accessor:

  • substanceHandleStart
  • substanceHandleStop (advanced usage)
  • substanceHandleSwitchHard (advanced usage)
  • substanceHandleGetState (advanced usage)

Grab Results:

  • substanceHandleGetOutputs

Substance data description accessors:

  • substanceHandleGetDesc
  • substanceHandleGetOutputDesc
  • substanceHandleGetInputDesc (advanced usage)

Synchronisation:

  • substanceHandleSyncSetLabel (advanced usage)
  • substanceHandleSyncGetLabel (advanced usage)

Typical call sequence for Substance handle (synchronous, grab all texture):

  • 1. substanceHandleInit (initialization from Substance cooked data)
  • 2. substanceHandleGetDesc (retrieve the number of outputs)
  • 3. substanceHandlePushOutputs (request the needed output textures)
  • 4. substanceHandleStart (launch the rendering process)
  • 5. substanceHandleGetOutputs (grab the outputs textures)
  • 6. substanceHandleRelease (close the handle)

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct SubstanceHandle_ SubstanceHandle

Substance engine handle structure pre-declaration (C/C++ compatible).

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum SubstanceOutputSelectionOption

Selection list interpretation flag.

Used by the substanceHandlePushOutputs and substanceHandleGetOutputs functions.

Allows to select how the values in the selection list should be interpreted:

  • textures are selected by output indices
  • textures are selected by identifiers
Enumerator:
Substance_OutOpt_OutIndex  Index output selection (default)
Substance_OutOpt_TextureId  Texture unique identifiers output selection
Substance_OutOpt_CopyNeeded  Volatile Selec. list, copy needed (default)
Substance_OutOpt_DoNotCopy  Persistent Selection list

enum SubstancePushOption

Render list push options (flags).

Context structure and related functions definitions Texture (results) structure and related functions definitions Callbacks signatures definitions Substance data description definitions Output description definitions Input description definitions Texture used as input, contains platform specific texture and format info Hardware resource dispatching requirements definitions Platform dependent definitions Error codes list Basic type defines Used by the substanceHandlePush[...] functions.

Allows to set the 'Hint only' flag

Enumerator:
Substance_PushOpt_NotAHint  Not a hint (default)
Substance_PushOpt_HintOnly  Hint only flag

enum SubstanceStartOption

Start options.

Used by substanceHandleStart 'flags' parameter.

Enumerator:
Substance_Ending_Stop  Process stopped on end
Substance_Ending_Waiting  Process waiting, explicit stop needed

enum SubstanceStateFlag

Substante state flags.

Used by substanceHandleGetState 'state' output parameter.

Enumerator:
Substance_State_Started  Process currently running (Started)
Substance_State_Asynchronous  Asynchronous process running
Substance_State_EndingWaiting  Process started with Substance_Ending_Waiting option
Substance_State_NoMoreRender  The render list is empty
Substance_State_NoMoreRsc  Process idle: no hardware resources available
Substance_State_PendingCommand  User command (API calls) pending

enum SubstanceSyncOption

Synchronization options.

Enumerator:
Substance_Sync_Synchronous  Synchronous computation
Substance_Sync_Asynchronous  Asynchronous computation

Function Documentation

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleFlush ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle  ) 

Flush the render list.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
Flush ALL the items previously pushed in the render list. The process is not stopped: if other jobs are pushed just after the flush commands, the process proceed to these new jobs.

The internal cache is NOT flushed by this function.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleGetDesc ( const SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
SubstanceDataDesc *  substanceInfo 
)

Get the handle main description.

Parameters:
[in] substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle of which to get the description.
[out] substanceInfo Pointer to the information structure to fill.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleGetInputDesc ( const SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
unsigned int  inIndex,
SubstanceInputDesc *  substanceInDesc 
)

Get an input (render parameter) description.

Parameters:
[in] substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
inIndex Index of the input of which to get the description.
[out] substanceInDesc Pointer to the input information struct to fill.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.

The input index must be valid (< inputCount).

Returns:
Return 0 if succeed, an error code otherwise.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleGetOutputDesc ( const SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
unsigned int  outIndex,
SubstanceOutputDesc *  substanceOutDesc 
)

Get an output (texture result) description and current state.

Parameters:
[in] substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
outIndex Index of the output of which to get the description.
[out] substanceOutDesc Pointer to the texture information struct to fill.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.

The output index must be valid (< outputCount).

Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleGetOutputs ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
unsigned int  flags,
unsigned int  outIndexOrId,
unsigned int  outCount,
SubstanceTexture  substanceTexture[] 
)

Grab output texture results.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle to grab texture from.
flags One of SubstanceOutputSelectionOption flags (only Substance_OutOpt_TextureIndex or Substance_OutOpt_TextureId flags are supported). Set to 0 to simply grab textures from its index numbers.
outIndexOrId Index of the first output to grab or Id of the texture to grab if the Substance_OutOpt_TextureId flag is set.
outCount Number of outputs to grab. Only significant if Substance_OutOpt_TextureId flag is not set (otherwise only 1 texture can be grab at a time).
[out] substanceTexture Pointer to the array of texture structures to fill. Its size must be equal or greater than outCount or >= to 1 if the Substance_OutOpt_TextureId flag is set.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.

The output index and count must be valid (outIndex + outCount =< outputCount).

Postcondition:
The corresponding outputs are transferred to the caller. The ownership is also transferred: the user have to free/release the texture when necessary.
Note:
Is it not necessary to use this function for the output textures allocated via the SubstanceCallbackOutputMalloc callback: these textures are NOT stored by Substance and NULL pointers will be returned by this function.
Warning:
Result textures are NOT counted in the memory budget of the Substance handle. Memory budget must be adjusted if necessary.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise (returns Substance_Error_NotComputed if the output is not already computed).
This function can be called at any time, even during a computation.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleGetState ( const SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
size_t *  jobUserData,
unsigned int *  state 
)

Get the computation process state.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle to get the state from.
[out] jobUserData If not NULL, returns the user data associated with the render list item currently processed. Returns 0 if no process is currently running.
[out] state If not NULL, returns an integer containing the current state: combination of SubstanceStateFlag flags.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
This function can be called at any time for processes started both in asynchronous or synchronous mode.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleInit ( SubstanceHandle **  substanceHandle,
SubstanceContext *  substanceContext,
unsigned char *  substanceDataPtr,
size_t  substanceDataSize,
const SubstanceHardResources *  substanceRscInitial 
)

Substance engine handle initialization from context and data.

Parameters:
[out] substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle to initialize.
substanceContext Pointer to the Substance context used for the rendering of substance data.
substanceDataPtr Pointer to the substance cooked data to render.
substanceDataSize Size of the substanceDataPtr buffer in bytes. Used only for debug purposes. Can be 0 (no overflow checks can be done).
[in] substanceRscInitial Pointer to initial hardware resource dispatching. Set this parameter to NULL to use the default parameters of the engine for the platform.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously un-initialized or released.

The context must be valid (correctly initialized) and remain valid during the handle lifetime.

The Substance data must be present and valid during the handle lifetime. It must be at least 16 bytes aligned.

Postcondition:
The handle is now valid (if no errors occurred).
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
Dynamic allocations of intermediate scratch buffers are done in this function. This function is quite fast (## to evaluate ##) and does not use API/hardware related resources (i.e. it is GPU-calls-free).

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandlePushOutputs ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
unsigned int  flags,
const unsigned int  selectList[],
unsigned int  selectListCount,
size_t  jobUserData 
)

Push a new set of outputs in the render list.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
flags Generation flags. A combination of SubstancePushOption and SubstanceOutputSelectionOption flags. These flags allow to choose the selectList parameter behavior and to set the hint flag.
[in] selectList Pointer to the array of textures to render. Can be NULL: all data outputs are selected. Otherwise the array is interpreted according to the 'flags' parameter value:
  • Substance_OutOpt_OutIndex (default): the list of integers is interpreted as output indices.
  • Substance_OutOpt_TextureId: list of output unique identifiers.
By default, the selectList data is copied by Substance. If the data is persistent (always present in memory), set the Substance_OutOpt_DoNotCopy flag to avoid copy.
selectListCount Number of entries in the selectList array.
jobUserData User data (integer/pointer) to associate with the job. This value is transmited to callback functions: it allows tracking of the job lifetime. This parameter is optional, e.g. set to 0 by default.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized.

If the Substance_OutOpt_DoNotCopy flag is set, the selectList buffer must remain valid during the job lifetime.

Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
A call to this function describes a job. This job is added at the end of the render list. Pending jobs are not affected.

If the Substance_PushOpt_HintOnly flag is set, the outputs are pushed into the render list as usual, but they will not be rendered. This feature allows the game engine to send hints to Substance (based on the game level design and/or the player behavior). These hints allow Substance to anticipate future computations and manage internal pools accordingly.
Hints must be pushed at the end of the render list: Non-hints jobs cannot be appended after hints jobs.

The outputs of the list are not rendered in the order of the list. However the jobs of the render list are processed sequentially without any reordering.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandlePushSetInput ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
unsigned int  flags,
unsigned int  inIndex,
SubstanceInputType  inType,
void *  value,
size_t  jobUserData 
)

Set input (render param.) value. Action appended in the render list.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
flags Combination of SubstancePushOption flags. These flags allow to choose the way this item is added to the render list and the hint flag.
inIndex Index of the input to set the value for.
inType Type of the value
value Pointer to value. Can be NULL if Substance_PushOpt_HintOnly flag is set.
The concrete type of the value depends on inType:
  • Substance_IType_Float, Substance_IType_Float2/3/4: array of 1/2/3/4 float(s).
  • Substance_IType_Integer: an int value.
  • Substance_IType_Image: a pointer to a SubstanceTextureInput structure. Must be correctly filled and remain valid during the handle lifetime.
  • Substance_IType_Mesh: ## to determine, NYI ##.
  • Substance_IType_String: an ASCII or UNICODE string (platform dependent).
jobUserData User data (integer/pointer) to associate with the render list item. This value is transmited to callback functions: it allows tracking of the render list item lifetime. This parameter is optional, e.g. set to 0 by default.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.

The input index must be valid (< inputCount).

The concrete type of the input and inType must match. Except if the Substance_PushOpt_HintOnly flag is set.

Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
A call to this function does not modify the input immediatly, but pushes a new item in the render list. Like substanceHandlePushOutputs, this function handles the Substance_PushOpt_HintOnly flag (see substanceHandlePushOutputs description for further information).

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleRelease ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle  ) 

Substance engine handle release.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle to release.
Precondition:
The handle must be already initialized and there must be no generation processes currently running.
Postcondition:
This handle is not valid any more (it can be re-initialized). Non-grabbed result textures are released.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleStart ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
unsigned int  flags 
)

Computation process launch, process the render list.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle to compute.
flags Combination of SubstanceStartOption and SubstanceSyncOption enumerations.
Set Substance_Sync_Asynchronous to launch the process in another thread and to return immediatly (does not wait for process termination).
Set Substance_Ending_Waiting to force asynchronous process waiting for further computation at render list ending. When this flag is set, an explicit stop (substanceHandleStop) is needed. Ignored if Substance_Sync_Asynchronous flag is not set.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized, the render list must be previously filled by substanceHandlePushOutputs calls.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
Returns immediatly if asynchronous mode is selected.
Returns at the end of computation otherwise, i.e.:
  • The end of the render list is reached
  • Through substanceHandleStop call (from another thread or through a callback function).
  • Current/switched hardware resource dispatching does not allocate any process unit (see substanceHandleSwitchHard function).
This function is used to consume the render list.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleStop ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
SubstanceSyncOption  syncMode 
)

Cancel/Stop the computation process.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
syncMode Set Substance_Sync_Asynchronous to return immediatly (does not wait for the actual process termination).
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
Returns immediatly if syncMode is Substance_Sync_Asynchronous or the current process is launched synchronously (allows call through a callback function or from another thread).
Returns at actual computation end otherwise.
Stops the computation process. DOES NOT flush the render list.
This function can be called at any time for processes started both in asynchronous or synchronous mode.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleSwitchHard ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
SubstanceSyncOption  syncMode,
const SubstanceHardResources *  substanceRscNew,
const SubstanceHardResources *  substanceRscNext,
unsigned int  duration 
)

On the fly switch to another hardware resource dispatching.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
syncMode Synchronous flag, handled differently depending on whether the duration is finite or not, a current process is running or not and this process is synchronous or not (see the returned value description).
[in] substanceRscNew Pointer to new hardware resource dispatching requirements and hints. Set this parameter to NULL in order to use the initial resource dispatching given at the substanceHandleInit function call (or platform default ones if not given).
[in] substanceRscNext Pointer to hardware resource dispatching used at window time end (see the 'duration' parameter). Set this parameter to NULL in order to use initial resource dispatching (see substanceRscNew). Meaningful only if duration is finite.
duration Duration of the switch in nanoseconds. Can be 0: INFINITE.
Precondition:
The handle must be previously initialized and valid.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
Return behavior
Parameters --> Finite/Synchronous Finite/Asynchronous Infinite/Synchronous Infinite/Asynchronous
No process running Returns immediatly Returns immediatly Returns immediatly Returns immediatly
Asynchronous process Returns at duration end Returns immediatly Returns when the switch is effective Returns immediatly
Synchronous process Returns immediatly (1) Returns immediatly (1) Returns immediatly (1) Returns immediatly (1)
(1): Allows call through a callback function or from another thread.
This function allows to change the hardware resource dispatching during or before a computation (e.g. use a GPU between vsync idle time: time-slicing strategy).
The change is not limited in time if 'duration' == 0 (INFINITE). Otherwise, the switch is clocked: 'duration' defines a time range in nanoseconds.

The process can be put in standby if the SubstanceHardResources does not allocate any process unit.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleSyncGetLabel ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
size_t *  labelValuePtr 
)

Synchronization function: accessor to the synchronization label value.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
[out] labelValuePtr Pointer to the variable that will receive the label value.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
The synchronization label value is modified with the substanceHandleSyncSetLabel function.
The default label value is 0.

SUBSTANCE_EXPORT unsigned int substanceHandleSyncSetLabel ( SubstanceHandle *  substanceHandle,
size_t  labelValue 
)

Synchronization function: set the handle synchronization label value.

Parameters:
substanceHandle Pointer to the Substance handle.
labelValue The value to assign to the handle synchronization label. This value will be really set when this call is processed by the Substance internal command buffer loop.
Returns:
Returns 0 if succeeded, an error code otherwise.
The synchronization label value can be accessed with the substanceHandleSyncGetLabel function.
This function allows the user to check if previous commands were already processed by the Substance handle. It can be used for discarding deprecated callbacks.
